result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Mulcrone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Police Department.  To be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence June 17, 2015 by 7:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew P Mulcrone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Court accepts amended information.  Guilty plea entered to amended count #1 after completion of drug treatment court.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
FINE: $505.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid within 90 days. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant graduated DTC today. File to be forwarded to Judge Ramirez to be set for sentencing.
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision. Obligations are paid in full.
Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant remains compliant with the program. Graduation scheduled for 06/22/16.
Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant remains compliant with the program.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date: 06/15/16
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on noncompliance:  the Court orders an overnight sanction - STAYED.  Defendant to write autobiography.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Andrew P Mulcrone in court with attorney Kelsey Morin for Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment and approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 

Count 2:
- 5 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation
- 18 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 18 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine of $1,179.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
CONDITION TIME: 10 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence June 17, 2015 by 7:00 pm.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
